intro: Bunium mauritanicum var. aphyllum, commonly known as the leafless fennel, is a perennial herb native to the arid regions of North Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic plants like parsley and dill. The plant is characterized by its absence of leaves, with only a basal rosette of modified leaves and a single, hollow, cylindrical stem. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in umbels, typical of the family. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils.
